thread.title: All Blacks get ahead in leadership stakes
thread.title_full: All Blacks get ahead in leadership stakes - Telegraph

author: Oliver Pickup
title: All Blacks get ahead in leadership stakes
text: New Zealand have played 105 Tests since they were knocked out of the 2007 World Cup by France at the quarter-final stage. Of these, they have won 91 and lost just 12. A root-and-branch review undertaken after that shock defeat concluded that the team were “culturally dysfunctional” in terms of leadership development. So specific programmes were devised by former All Blacks coach, selector and player, Sir Brian Lochore, and mental skills coach Gilbert Enoka. The objective was “to win rugby games through self-reliance, self-belief, leadership of self and others, demonstrated through smart decisions on and off the field especially under pressure.” Effective leadership since, as provided by captain Richie McCaw in particular, has inspired the All Blacks to new heights. In 2013 they became the first professional international side to go a year with a 100 per cent record: 14 games, 14 wins. “They try to get better every time they play,” head coach Steve Hansen has said. “They had better, because if they don’t they will be past history. If you have a goal like that, you have a chance.” Sean Fitzpatrick, who led the All Blacks in 51 Tests, talks about remembering defeats more than wins and being honest in challenging yourself and about making sacrifices if you want to be the best. Those qualities are ingrained in every All Black. Redefining everyday life Leadership tips from life coach Sharon Woodcock ( comecoachwithme.com ) In your career… “Whether you’re the chief executive or on the first rung of the ladder, you can demonstrate leadership and a good teamwork ethic by setting goals, listening to others and expressing positivity by praising and thanking colleagues.” In fitness… “To get the most out of fitness – and to stick to a routine – implement leadership skills such as time management and goal setting. Identify your goal, decide how much time you need to achieve it, and work it into your diary.” • For more information on health and lifestyle, visit vitality.com
